title: Andersonville National Historic Site: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials The park offers a wide array of activities and materials to explore the history of Andersonville and the experiences of prisoners of war throughout American history.  All Curriculum Materials   Featured Lesson Plan    Memory Star Project Learn More     Field Trips Park staff have developed a series of activities and on-site programs designed to help students understand the experiences of Union Prisoners of war held at the Camp Sumter military prison during the American Civil War. These activities include both ranger-led and teacher-led activities. All Field Trips   Featured Field Trip    Ranger-Led Programs at the Andersonville Prison site Learn More     Materials to Loan The park offers a loan program where teachers can bring the two park films into their classroom. Watching one or both films is a valuable way to prepare for a site visit, or bring a little bit of Andersonville directly to your students.  All Materials to Loan   Park Film Loan Program    Bring the park films to your class. Learn More
